title: The Theranos Trial: Former Safeway CEO Testifies Over Failed Partnership
summary: Steven Burd led grocery chain as it invested over $350 million in a deal that never fully materialized. SAN JOSE, Calif.-Safeway Inc.'s former top executive testified Wednesday that the grocery-story chain relied on Theranos Inc. founder Elizabeth Holmes's promises when it decided to invest over $350 million in a partnership with the blood-testing company.

title: Magazine Publisher Meredith Agrees to Be Sold to Barry Diller's IAC
summary: The roughly $2.7 billion deal will combine brands like People, Better Homes & Gardens and Investopedia. Barry Diller's IAC/InterActiveCorp . has reached a roughly $2.7 billion deal to buy magazine publisher Meredith Corp. , a bet on online publishing that will combine brands such as People, Better Homes & Gardens and Investopedia.

title: Biden's Broadband Boondoggle
summary: The infrastructure bill slates tens of billions for rural networks. History suggests most will be wasted.. The Biden administration's $1 trillion "infrastructure plan" has generated controversy, but few doubt that America is in need of repair. President Biden's words resonated when he claimed that "America is 13th in the world in infrastructure."

title: The Entitlements of U.S. Decline
summary: Biden says his plans will make America great again. Ask Europe how that has turned out.. Democrats are scrambling to find an argument, any argument, that sells their $5 trillion spending plan to a skeptical public. The latest, and startling, attempt is President Biden's claim that all of his new entitlements will, well, make America greater.

title: Twitter Sells Mobile Ad Firm MoPub to AppLovin for $1.05 Billion
summary: Social-media network says sale will help it pursue its goal of doubling revenue. Twitter Inc. is selling mobile ad firm MoPub to AppLovin Corp. for $1.05 billion in cash, the company said Wednesday.

title: Cake Liberation Day
summary: A victory in New Jersey for people who want to sell what they bake.. In 49 states in America, people are free to bake cookies or cakes at home and then sell them at a local farmer's market. But not in New Jersey, where a home baker who tried that would face a fine of up to $1,000.

title: Merrick Garland's Federal Offense
summary: Threats against school boards are an issue for local law enforcement.. Is there a culture-war issue that Merrick Garland won't jump into? We can't think of one, and now the Attorney General is nosing the Justice Department into debates at local school boards.

title: Corruption on Trial in Philadelphia
summary: The ties between a union boss and Democrats will be on display.. Brotherly love abounds between big labor and Democrats, but in Philadelphia the bond may have been criminal. That's the allegation in a corruption trial that began Monday in a federal court in Pennsylvania.

title: Student-Loan Forgiveness to Include More Public-Sector Workers
summary: Biden administration plans to overhaul Public Service Loan Forgiveness program, potentially helping roughly 550,000 borrowers. The Biden administration plans to overhaul a student-loan forgiveness program to make it easier for more public-sector workers to qualify for debt relief following a lobbying push from the nation's largest teachers union and others.

title: Twitch Hack Reveals How Much Platform's Biggest Streamers Make
summary: Leak on 4chan online chat forum seems to involve source codes and creator payouts from the Amazon-owned streaming company. Amazon. com Inc.-owned Twitch Interactive, the videogame streaming platform, said Wednesday it suffered a data breach, with information leaked on the online chat forum 4chan.

title: Justice Department to Redouble Efforts in Combating White-Collar Crime, Official Says
summary: A senior DOJ official previewed changes to the agency's investigation of white-collar crime, including a 'surge' in resources and a focus on incentivizing corporate compliance. A senior Justice Department official gave a first glimpse into the Biden administration's approach to white-collar crime, saying the agency would commit new resources and tools to weeding out wrongdoing by companies and their executives that harm U.S. national security.

title: Students in a 'Hostile Environment'
summary: A public school teacher challenges critical race theory.. Sometimes all it takes is one great teacher to turn young lives around. In Providence, R.I., the question is whether the radicals who run public education will prevent one very courageous teacher from serving children in need. This week brings news of the pressure brought to bear on educators who refuse to toe the ideological line.

title: Biden Administration to Spend $1 Billion to Boost Rapid Covid-19 Tests
summary: White House Covid-19 coordinator Jeff Zients says tens of millions of additional tests will arrive on the market in the coming weeks. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration said it will put $1 billion toward the purchase of rapid, at-home coronavirus tests in a bid to ramp up supply amid shortages spurred by increased demand.

title: When Judges Abuse Public Confidence
summary: Ethics rules prohibit the appearance of unethical conduct as well as actual unethical conduct.. Regarding "Federal Judges Heard Cases Despite a Financial Interest" (Page One, Sept. 29): Annual ethics training is required for all federal employees, including judges. As a career Navy lawyer, I conducted annual ethics training for civilian and military employees. I once had to recuse myself from defending a suit filed by a corporation represented by my husband's law firm, but not by my husband personally.

title: Marijuana, Alertness and Chainsaws
summary: Employees in sensitive jobs must stay alert.. Marijuana use by employees is the cause du jour ("At Work: New Questions as Marijuana Comes to Work," Personal Journal, Sept. 30). What employers should really care about, however, is an employee's alertness level while performing the job. This holds true all the more so for employees in safety-sensitive jobs such as tower repair, where a lack of alertness could result in death.

title: Faith, Agnosticism and the Limits of Human Reason
summary: In matters of belief about God, we do not and cannot know.. As a former minister turned agnostic, I enjoyed reading "Why Atheists Need Faith" (Houses of Worship, Sept. 24) by Michael Guillen, a scientist and former atheist turned Christian. Just as Mr. Guillen arrived at Christianity during his doctoral studies by debunking core tenets of his atheistic worldview, I left Christianity by studying the New Testament, not through the lens of faith, but in graduate and postgraduate settings through the lens of the historical-critical method of biblical scholarship. It raises questions about the authorship and authenticity of scripture.

title: The First Amendment Right to Cancel
summary: The right of private actors to free speech includes the right to refuse to deal with the odious.. Regarding Ted Rall's op-ed "Free Speech Has Consequences, but Should Firing Be One?" (Oct. 1): Mr. Rall acknowledges the fundamental difference between public and private employers-the former are subject to First Amendment constraints, the latter are not-but he seems to decry this state of affairs. What he overlooks is that the right of private actors to free speech includes the right to refuse to deal or do business with, or to boycott or cancel, those whose speech is viewed as objectionable.

title: The Academy Museum of Motion Pictures Review: And the Award for Wokeness Goes to...
summary: The pricey new Los Angeles venture tries too hard to satisfy current cultural trends, losing track of film history in the process.

title: Make It Clear: The U.S. Will Defend Taiwan
summary: The need for strategic clarity is urgent.. The risk of a serious crisis in the Taiwan Strait is growing as China's military flew 93 sorties over three days near Taiwan ("China Puts Pressure on Taiwan With Surge of Military Flights," Page One, Oct. 4). A crisis scenario can be avoided, however, if Washington would make clear that the U.S. will defend Taiwan for geostrategic reasons as well as to restore America's credibility after the widespread dismay of Afghanistan withdrawal. The need for a U.S. policy of definite strategic clarity toward Taiwan has never been more urgent.

title: Taxes, 'Fair Share' and Earnings
summary: What is fair is in the eye of the taxpayer.. Concern over paying for government programs is all well and good ("Joe Biden's Economic Fantasy World," Free Expression, Sept. 28). But when Gerard Baker complains that, according to the Tax Foundation, the top 1% pay 40% of all taxes while the bottom 50% pay less than 3%, he neglects to mention the percentage of total income made by each group, top and bottom. These are also relevant statistics that would present the tax proposals in a different light. What is fair is in the eye of the taxpayer.

title: Everything Is Public Health
summary: How to wound up blind-sided by an epidemic.. Bill Galipeau writes that social media is "the public-health issue of our time, akin to big tobacco in earlier years" (Letters, Sept. 27). This kind of attitude is how our public-health establishment wound up blind-sided by an actual epidemic.

title: Stocks Close Higher After Morning Selloff
summary: S&P 500, Nasdaq, Dow finish higher thanks to afternoon rebound. U.S. stocks rose Wednesday, a healthy turnaround after a morning marked by broad losses across sectors. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell as much as 460 points in the morning before rallying in the afternoon and ending the day more than 100 points higher.

title: Camille Saint-Saëns's Deep Catalog
summary: The centenary of the multi-hyphenate composer's death is the perfect opportunity for those new to his music to discover his genius and for veterans to dive into his oeuvre.

title: China's Unstable Political Economy
summary: Evergrande's collapse is a sign of deeper weakness, just when Xi is impatient to challenge the U.S.. The world has been watching as the Chinese real-estate giant Evergrande flails, and some have been asking whether Beijing will soon have a moment akin to 2008's collapse of Lehman Brothers in America. Xi Jinping may manage to prevent the burst of the real estate bubble, but China's economy isn't heading for more-sustainable growth. Evergrande's woes are a reminder that China's political economy under Mr. Xi has become even more unstable, even as Beijing grows more impatient to displace America as the dominant power. Time is not on China's side.

title: Why Has Biden Surrendered to the Left?
summary: There are three possible explanations, and they won't help Democrats in 2022.. There was no grand ceremony on a battleship, no general handing over his sword as a band played "The World Turned Upside Down," no signing of a document in a simple country house witnessed by a victor in a mud-splattered uniform. Nonetheless, what we saw last week was an unconditional surrender by President Joe Biden to the demands of his party's left wing. He'll set the bipartisan infrastructure bill aside until Sen. Bernie Sanders' $5.5 trillion welfare state expansion is signed into law. (The usual estimate of $3.5 trillion assumes its programs will be allowed to expire, which they won't.)

title: A Book Burning in 21st-Century Canada
summary: Comics, biographies and encyclopedias go up in smoke in the name of 'purification.'. Mention book burning and people think of Nazi Germany, or maybe Anthony Comstock. Yet the practice has made a comeback recently, in Canada of all places.

title: Can Manchin and Sinema Save All 50 U.S. States?
summary: Joe Biden's massive laws will erode the state powers protected by the Constitution's 10th Amendment.. Joe Biden's gazillion-dollar federal spendathon is coming up short, not because the opposition won't take his statesmanlike appeal to "get out of the way" but because the Senate is split 50-50 and Democrats have a microscopic majority in the House. You know what that means. Whenever the Democratic left today can't build a mandate at the polls, it has an automatic default: Form a mob.

title: 'William III' Review: When England Went Orange
summary: He led armies in the ﬁeld, constructed alliances across Europe, and accepted an invitation from the English to cross the channel and become king.. It is commonly believed that the last successful invasion of England was William the Conqueror's in 1066. Not so. In November 1688, a largely Dutch army of 24,000 landed at Torbay in Devonshire, and within a few months its commander-William, Prince of Orange-was king of England. Some might say that this was not really an invasion: first because William had come at the invitation of opposition politicians who had urged him to depose James II and restore "the liberties of England"; and second because there was no battle, most of James's generals having crossed over to William. There were, however, battles in Scotland and Ireland. The so-called Glorious Revolution was also termed a "bloodless" one, but only in England and not throughout the British Isles.

title: Facebook Slows New Products to Examine Possible Impact
summary: Social-media company puts on hold some work for existing products while it addresses blowback from whistleblower, lawmakers. Facebook Inc. has delayed the rollout of new products in recent days, people familiar with the matter said, amid media reports and congressional hearings related to a trove of internal documents showing harms from its platforms.

title: NASA Says Boeing's Starliner Won't Attempt Launch Again This Year
summary: U.S. space agency reassigns two astronauts from Boeing missions to a future SpaceX flight. Boeing Co. 's Starliner space vehicle won't get to attempt launch again this year, NASA officials said Wednesday, and two astronauts who were meant to fly on it were reassigned to a future mission using a SpaceX ship.

title: NBCUniversal Names Kelly Campbell as Peacock's President
summary: Move comes days after Campbell resigned from her role as president of Walt Disney's Hulu streaming platform. NBCUniversal said former Hulu chief Kelly Campbell would become president of Peacock, a year-old streaming platform that parent company Comcast Corp. is looking to build into a powerhouse.

title: GM Aims High on Revenue, Challenges Tesla With Electric SUV
summary: The Detroit car maker aims to more than double revenue by 2030, aided by new battery-electric models and auto-related services. General Motors Co. set one of its most ambitious financial targets in years on Wednesday, telling investors it aims to more than double revenue by 2030 with an influx of new battery-electric models and auto-related services.

title: Texas Shooting Injures 4 at Timberview High School
summary: Suspect Timothy George Simpkins turned himself in, police said. ARLINGTON, Texas-A fight between students ended in gunfire at a high school in Arlington, Texas, leaving one in critical condition and three others injured, officials said.

title: China Would Be Able to Launch Attack on Taiwan by 2025, Island's Defense Minister Warns
summary: Taiwan's military faces its most dire challenge from Beijing in decades, Chiu Kuo-cheng said after sorties by Chinese fighters and bombers. TAIPEI-Taiwan's military is facing its most dire challenge from China in decades, the island's defense minister said, reflecting a surge in tensions after a flurry of Chinese military sorties in the region sparked expressions of concern from the U.S.

title: White House Plans Biden-Xi Call in Coming Weeks
summary: Planned meeting follows Beijing stepping up military flights near Taiwan, U.S. exercises east of island. WASHINGTON-White House officials are planning to schedule a virtual meeting between President Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping in coming weeks, a senior administration official said.

title: Nobel in Chemistry Awarded for Work on Molecular Tool
summary: U.S.-based scientist David MacMillan and Benjamin List of Germany are honored for work on organocatalysis. The Nobel Prize in Chemistry was jointly awarded to U.S.-based scientist David MacMillan and Benjamin List of Germany for their work developing a new tool for producing molecules with a range of useful applications.

title: Russia Opens Probe Into Video Reports of Tortured Prisoners
summary: Several officials were fired in cases that human-rights advocates say point to systematic torture in the country's prisons. MOSCOW-Russian law enforcement opened criminal investigations into reports of widespread prisoner abuse and several officials in the penitentiary system were fired in cases that human-rights advocates say point to systematic torture in prisons across the country.

title: Supreme Court Quizzes Government Ban on 'Black Site' Testimony
summary: Justices raise questions about U.S. position that allowing CIA contractors to testify over treatment of detainee Abu Zubaydah would endanger national security. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court on Wednesday heard the government's plea to block Central Intelligence Agency contractors from testifying regarding the brutal interrogation program they oversaw at a "black site" in Poland.

title: Watch Out! (Thursday Crossword, October 7)
Biden Antitrust Nominee Gets Warm Senate Reception
summary: Jonathan Kanter promises strong enforcement if confirmed as Justice Department antitrust chief. WASHINGTON-President Biden's nominee to lead the Justice Department's antitrust division sailed through his Senate confirmation hearing Wednesday, pledging strong enforcement and receiving bipartisan support from lawmakers concerned about corporate dominance.

title: College Admissions Cheating Case Heads to Jury
summary: Prosecutors, defense lawyers give closing arguments regarding fraud, bribery charges against parents Gamal Abdelaziz and John Wilson. BOSTON-A federal jury is set to begin deliberations Thursday in the Varsity Blues college-admissions case, following a nearly four-week criminal trial for two parents accused of committing fraud and bribery to get their children admitted to the University of Southern California as recruited athletes.

title: From the Apple Watch and Ray-Ban Stories to Oura: How Wearable Tech Got Stylish
summary: A stylish new generation of wearables that includes Ray-Ban's Stories glasses, Oura's sleek ring and Whoop's subtle band has made smart accessories fashion must-haves. RAY-BAN'S Stories glasses can record video, hands free, and boast Facebook technology. They can also play music via ear speakers and respond to basic commands. ("Hey Facebook, write this article," sadly did not work.) But here's their most remarkable attribute: They just look like glasses. Released last month, Stories Wayfarers weigh just five grams more than an analog pair and if not for a tiny white light that shines when you're shooting, they appear identical to tech-free Wayfarers-a seminal frame worn by Muhammad Ali, Madonna and countless others.

title: Netflix's 'Squid Game' Costumes Are Already a Halloween Hit
summary: From affordable options on Amazon to easy DIY creations, costumes from Netflix's hit South Korean show 'Squid Game' are sure to be inescapable this Halloween.. "Squid Game," the South Korean dystopian thriller which debuted on Netflix on Sept. 17, is on track to be the platform's biggest hit to date. With Halloween on the horizon, the tremendously popular show has also spawned an onslaught of "Squid Game" costumes. On Amazon.com , you'll find over 2,000 results for the term "Squid Game costume." Google trends, the search engine's in-house platform that tracks user interest, reported that for the week ending October 2, searches for "Squid Game costume" reached a new high. And though the holiday is still weeks away, Instagram users are already giddily posting their themed outfits with the hashtag #SquidGameCostume.

title: Angelina Jolie Sells Stake in French Wine Estate, Capping Fight With Brad Pitt Over Miraval
summary: The sale comes after the divorced couple couldn't agree on a buyout of Jolie's stake. Actress Angelina Jolie sold her stake in a French château and winery business to a third party, the latest plot twist in a yearslong fight with ex-husband Brad Pitt over the future of the assets.

title: Navy Contractor Accused of Inflating Bills for Port Services by $50 Million
summary: The U.S. is seeking the extradition of the Malta-based contractor in a case highlighting persisting corruption and the Navy's failure to stop it. A port support-services company is accused of overcharging the U.S. Navy $50 million in a federal prosecution highlighting persisting corruption in naval contracting and the Navy's failure to root it out.

title: Using Your House for a Movie or TV Set Can Be Lucrative but Also Disruptive
summary: Homes that fit the bill as a location for a movie or TV show can generate a nice revenue for their owners. But the shoots can also leave some damage.. New Yorker Mary Kay Seery, 60, a real-estate broker, recalls that people were shocked when she and her husband, Billy Seery, 61, moved in 1998 from the East Village to Prospect Park South, a Brooklyn neighborhood known for its detached Victorian houses. At the time, it was considered the height of uncool by some of her friends.

title: TV Shows like 'Girls' and 'The Affair' Have Filmed in This Brooklyn Home
summary: Mary Kay Seery's house has starred in numerous films and TV shows over the past 20 years. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Six Shows and a Documentary to Stream This Week
summary: 'Acapulco' examines the price one pays for dreams; viewers try to identify the murderer in 'One of Us Is Lying'; and more to add to your queue. There are at least two unique looks at the service industry that are streaming this week: one involving blue skies and marriage proposals at a Mexico resort, the other filled with baked goods and safety belts. Plus, Peacock launches a high-school murder mystery. Here's where to find it all.

title: Biden Administration to Impose Cyber Requirements on 'High-Risk' Rail- Transit Systems
summary: Mandates deemed necessary because of surface- transportation systems' role in economy, potential importance to national security. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration will impose new cybersecurity requirements on some railroad and other surface-transit systems, the latest effort by the federal government to compel certain private industries to boost their cyber defenses in the face of proliferating ransomware attacks and other disruptive threats, officials said.

title: Who Is Kyrsten Sinema? It's Complicated
summary: A radical turned moderate, the Arizona Democrat is more interesting than the left's hostile caricatures.. 'Hi, I'm Kyrsten. I'm in the Arizona House and I'm a socialist." That's how the woman who's now her state's senior U.S. senator introduced herself to me when we met at an immigration conference in 2006. I found her to be more complicated than a slogan. I told her I worked for a federally sponsored job-training program in college and learned that she is a former social worker who is suspicious of impersonal bureaucracies and genuinely curious about other people.

title: As Central Banks Taper, Investors Should Take Cover
summary: Previously, the European Central Bank and the Fed offset each other's impact. No such luck this time.. Do you have too much money? Losing sleep over that ballooning bank account? Perhaps not. But spare a thought for Jerome Powell and Christine Lagarde, who must lead us all out of a global monetary glut. Facing essentially the same pandemic-era problem, the Federal Reserve and the European Central Bank have come to the same solution: drastically cut monthly net asset purchases. Unfortunately for financial markets, they will be pulling back at the same time, setting up 2022 as the year of the "taper tandem"-the fastest liquidity drain in a decade.

title: Rising Bond Yields, Falling Industrial Demand Behind Slumping Silver Prices
summary: Prices just completed their worst four-month run since November 2014. Silver is sliding at its fastest pace in years.

title: 'Crossroads' Review: God and Country in Franzen's Swinging '70s
summary: The new novel from the author of 'The Corrections' and 'Freedom.'. Across three years in the Cold War '50s, God, as never before, became part of the grammar of American daily life. In 1954, Congress passed a bipartisan amendment to the 1942 wartime flag code that added two words to our existing pledge of allegiance, our "nation indivisible" seeing "under God" inserted between them; in 1955, Congress unanimously voted to replace our de facto motto, E pluribus unum-Out of many, one-with "In God We Trust"; and in 1956, legislated that every piece of U.S. currency minted or printed thereafter would feature, prominently, our theistic motto. Thus kindergartners of the 1960s became the first generation of American public-school children to whom it would be unknown not to recite, every morning, a pledge overseen by a creator, children whose every nickel saved or squandered on bubble gum and Creamsicles or, later, prostitutes and bags of pot, would be underwritten by an implicitly Christian Lord. By the time John Lennon sang, in 1970, "God is a concept / by which we measure our pain," he was nondenominationally describing our metaphysical condition, but he was also dismantling a myth that sought to bind one American to another, one which, as never before, was tearing us apart.

title: Natural Gas Prices Take Wild Ride After Putin Comments
summary: Russian president said the country's gas supplies to Europe are set to reach a record this year. Russian President Vladimir Putin said Moscow was ready to work on stabilizing the global energy market, causing a sudden reversal in natural gas prices, which had earlier soared to their highest level on record.

title: World's First Malaria Vaccine Gets WHO Backing
summary: Decades in the making, the GlaxoSmithKline vaccine will be deployed in sub-Saharan Africa and other at-risk regions; 'historic day'. The World Health Organization on Wednesday recommended the widespread deployment of the world's first malaria vaccine to young children in sub-Saharan Africa and other at-risk regions, hoping to revive the fight against the mosquito-borne illness that kills more than 400,000 people every year.

title: From a Trillion-Dollar Coin to Invoking the 14th Amendment, How the U.S. Could Address the Debt Ceiling
summary: President Biden says Congress must act to increase borrowing limit; others see alternatives. The federal government could soon run out of money to pay its bills, raising questions about what the U.S. can do to avoid a historic default.

title: Real Phone Number Featured in 'Squid Game' Leads to Prank-Call Apocalypse
summary: The Netflix dystopian series is a world-wide blockbuster, but for South Koreans with the same or similar digits, it's a real-life nightmare. SEOUL-In an early scene of Netflix Inc.'s megahit "Squid Game," a charming stranger hands a business card to the show's debt-strapped protagonist. The card contains an eight-digit phone number. Those who call get unknowingly invited to a life-or-death competition where the winner reaps a massive financial prize.

title: NATO Kicks Out Eight Russian Officials
summary: Move extends wave of tit-for-tat expulsions between Western countries and Russia in recent years. BRUSSELS-The North Atlantic Treaty Organization said Wednesday it was ejecting eight members of the Russian delegation to the alliance, calling them undeclared intelligence officers.

title: At-Home Exercise Injuries Are Skyrocketing. Here's How to Stay Safe
summary: From varying your workouts to relying on virtual trainers, exercise experts share their best tips for staying safe whether you're on a Peloton or merely doing a push-up.. JOE JOHNSON knew better. A fitness instructor certified by the National Academy of Sports Medicine, he'd always safely bench pressed with a spotter at the gym. But with the pandemic "that wasn't an option," he said. When he hurt his shoulder during a particularly rigorous at-home solo session last September, he went to the hospital. "Turns out I'd torn my rotator cuff and couldn't train for six weeks," he said.

title: Coal Shortages Push Up Prices, Weigh on Economies
summary: Ahead of Glasgow climate summit, resurgent economies, Chinese demand highlight challenges to weaning the world off a polluting fossil fuel. HONG KONG-Coal supply shortages are pushing prices for the fuel to record highs and laying bare the challenges to weaning the global economy off one of its most important-and polluting-energy sources.

title: Boxing Legend Muhammad Ali's Art Sells for Nearly $1 Million in Auction
summary: The auction, held by Bonhams auctioneers in New York City, included various drawings and paintings from 'The Greatest'. Dozens of pieces of art created by boxing legend Muhammad Ali sold in an auction Tuesday for nearly $1 million.

title: 'Jerry Gogosian' Is an Art Critic for a New Generation
summary: Resume Subscription. Author

title: U.S. Trade Policy Adapts to a China That Will Never Change
summary: Biden's emerging China strategy doesn't involve China, instead focuses at home and on allies. President Biden's top trade official this week delivered an unusually bleak assessment of U.S. efforts over the past two decades to change China's trade practices, from subsidies and intellectual property to technology transfer.

title: Boris Johnson Says Migrants Are No Answer to Labor Shortages
summary: In speech to supporters, U.K. prime minister talks of new economic model but meets criticism from some traditional party backers. MANCHESTER, England-British Prime Minister Boris Johnson said he would press ahead with his government's pledge to end the influx of low-paid migrant workers despite the country's labor shortages, describing it as a radical change for the British economy.

title: Prada, Louis Vuitton and the 32 Best Looks of Fashion Week
summary: Europe's fashion shows made their triumphant return: the most stylish ensembles to know.. With Covid-19 restrictions relaxed enough in Europe's three major fashion capitals to welcome designers back from exile, shows in London, Milan and Paris chose surreal and original settings-from Prada's Tetris-cubed space and Fendi and Versace's "Fendace" jungle to Dior's pop-'60s cubes and Saint Laurent's smoke-machined view of the Eiffel Tower. Overall, much like designers in New York-where collections signaled a riotous, fringe-happy return to semi-normal social life-it was a swirl of positivity: "We needed something fun to happen," Balenciaga designer Demna Gvasalia told Vogue. Scroll to see the best looks from London, Milan and Paris's Spring/Summer 2022 Fashion Week, as selected by WSJ. Magazine's fashion team. For New York Fashion Week's best looks, go here.

title: BlackRock Is Adding Annuities to 401(k)s
summary: New retirement product will allow workers to receive stream of payments for the rest of their lives. BlackRock Inc. is putting annuities in American workers' 401(k)s.

title: After a Massacre, Honoring the Lost
summary: When 11 worshipers were killed at the Tree of Life Synagogue in Pittsburgh in 2018, a stranger made it his mission to memorialize them.. On Oct. 27, 2018, a man armed with an AR-15 semiautomatic rifle and three Glock semiautomatic pistols entered the Tree of Life Synagogue in Pittsburgh's Squirrel Hill neighborhood and began shooting. Robert Bowers, the suspect arrested at the scene, had chosen a Saturday morning, when worshipers would be at Shabbat services. He killed 11 people and wounded six, including two SWAT officers, before he was shot and surrendered.

title: Palantir, Shiba Inu, Apple, American Airlines: What to Watch in the Stock Market Today
summary: Palantir stock jumped on a U.S. Army contract; Airlines are slipping as fuel costs surge. Stocks dropped in morning trading, with major indexes losing ground amid broad-based selling. Here's what we're watching during Wednesday's regular session.

title: Who Is Facebook Whistleblower Frances Haugen? What to Know as She Testifies
summary: A look at the former Facebook employee who gathered documents that formed the foundation of the Journal's Facebook Files series. Frances Haugen, the former Facebook Inc. employee who gathered documents that formed the foundation of The Wall Street Journal's Facebook Files series showing its platforms are riddled with flaws that cause harm, appeared Tuesday before a Senate panel that is looking to toughen the law protecting children online.

title: Auschwitz-Birkenau Barracks Vandalized With Anti-Semitic Graffiti
summary: The spray-painted inscriptions included slogans denying the Holocaust; conservators are working on removing the vandalism. Wooden barracks at the Auschwitz-Birkenau Memorial and Museum were vandalized Tuesday with anti-Semitic inscriptions, the memorial said.

title: Iran's Armed-Drone Prowess Reshapes Security in Mideast
summary: Tehran uses off-the-shelf components to build armed drones used in attacks that challenge the U.S. and its allies in the Middle East. A deadly attack on an oil tanker by explosive-laden drones. Unmanned aircraft launched from the Gaza Strip hitting Israeli neighborhoods. Strikes on Saudi Arabian refineries and pipelines and on bases housing U.S. troops in Iraq.

title: With 'Landscape Hotels,' Luxury Nature Resorts Go Ultra Modern
summary: From Norway to the Catskills, wilderness lodges are losing their rough edges, re-emerging as high-design havens engineered to maximize the scenery. BEFORE THE DOOR closed behind me, I was transfixed. As I stepped into my cabin at Piaule, a new hotel in New York's Catskill Mountains, I faced a floor-to-ceiling, edge-to-edge wall of glass. It revealed an uninterrupted view of forest, thick with oak, hickory and maple trees-my own private IMAX-scaled nature epic.

title: Pro-Trump Candidate Field in Ohio Tests GOP
summary: Five candidates offer slight variations on Trumpism, in a contest that will test the ex-president's popularity. WELLINGTON, Ohio-For three decades, Rob Portman checked all the boxes of a classic pro-business Ohio Republican: Senior positions in both Bush White Houses. Twelve years in the House. A short stint as a lobbyist. A dozen years in the Senate.

title: The Varsity Blues Tapes: Hear Rick Singer Talk Through College Admissions Scandal
summary: Resume Subscription. When Federal Bureau of Investigation agents arrested dozens of wealthy parents, college coaches and others in March 2019 at the crescendo of the Operation Varsity Blues investigation, they released a 204-page affidavit detailing the payments and taped conversations that they say provide evidence of a brazen college admissions cheating scheme.

title: The Player-Led Venture That Turned Trading Cards Upside Down
summary: Before the deal that shook the trading-card industry, the NFL and MLB players unions set the stage for change by pooling their marketing rights in a venture called OneTeam Partners.. Tony Clark and DeMaurice Smith met in Midtown Manhattan four years ago to discuss a novel idea: pooling the rights of their two unions, representing Major League Baseball and National Football League players, to cut more lucrative deals for players in areas like videogames and trading cards.

title: Chinese Property Bonds Hammered by Default Worries, Weak Sales
summary: Dozens of dollar bonds sold by Chinese real-estate companies tumbled in price Wednesday. Shrinking apartment sales and an unexpected default have stoked fresh investor concerns about China's property developers, causing a steep selloff in U.S. dollar bonds from many of the sector's debt-laden companies.

title: Netflix's 'Maid' Cast: How a Bestselling Memoir Became an Acclaimed Miniseries
summary: Margaret Qualley, Andie MacDowell, Anika Noni Rose, Margot Robbie and Molly Smith Metzler on how they made a show about poverty, welfare and domestic abuse that didn't feel like a lecture.. The new Netflix series Maid opens in darkness. A woman sneaks out of her bed as quietly as possible, so as not to wake her sleeping partner. She scoops her toddler daughter up from her bed, leaves the trailer she lives in and gets them both into her car, pulling away as her boyfriend starts banging on the car. Viewers soon learn the woman is Alex (played by Margaret Qualley), a protagonist adapted from Stephanie Land's 2019 memoir, Maid: Hard Work, Low Pay and a Mother's Will to Survive. Even though she's just escaped from her partner, Sean (Love, Simon's Nick Robinson), who punches a wall before throwing glass at her in front of their young daughter, Alex's challenges are only beginning.

title: China's Property Fantasia Turns Nightmarish
summary: Property developer Fantasia's missed payment is the sector's latest red flag. But the real question mark is housing prices themselves.. Was it all just a pleasant dream? Investors in Chinese property developer Fantasia's dollar debt who a year ago were feasting on juicy, but still single-digit yields, now find themselves without their principal. Many others could find themselves in a similar position soon.

title: Are Your Coffee Table Books Pretentious?
summary: Clearly, an oversize folio topped with dusty knickknacks has rarely been cracked open for a read. Is this legit interior design or an insult to knowledge? Design pros debate.. For the recurring series, That's Debatable, we take on a contentious issue of the day and present two spirited arguments-one in favor and the other emphatically opposed. Previous installments from the series are here.

title: House Panel Probes Possible Trump White House Role in Yellow Corp. Bailout
summary: A Democratic-led investigating committee says email exchanges link the Trump administration to a $700 million pandemic-relief loan to the troubled trucking company. The chairman of a Democratic-led House oversight panel said new documents show the Trump administration may have been involved in helping financially troubled trucking company Yellow Corp. obtain a $700 million pandemic-relief loan from the Treasury Department.

title: Bond Investors Aren't Buying Crypto Craze
summary: Debt issued by Coinbase, El Salvador performed poorly in recent weeks, showing bond investors' wariness of cryptocurrency's volatility. Bond markets held two informal referendums on cryptocurrencies recently. The results weren't pretty.

title: Red Sox Renew Ownership of Yankees in AL Wild Card
summary: With a decisive 6-2 victory, the Red Sox advanced to the ALDS to face the Tampa Bay Rays.. BOSTON-The Boston Red Sox dispatched the New York Yankees in the American League wild-card game Tuesday night, and the outcome only reinforced an irrefutable truth: The rivalry that is supposed to be among the fiercest in American professional sports has become weirdly lopsided.

title: So Your Bank Is Buying Another: Don't Panic
summary: Rising valuations for bigger lenders means owning an acquirer could be better deal for shareholders than in the past. There's an urge to merge among U.S. banks right now. Investors might not need to run for cover.

title: Tech Investor Francisco Partners Targets $10 Billion for Latest Flagship
summary: The San Francisco-based firm previously raised around $10 billion across three separate funds in 2020. Francisco Partners, a technology-focused private-equity firm, plans to hit the fundraising trail later this year with the aim of collecting some $10 billion for its seventh flagship fund, according to people familiar with the situation.

title: The Mom Project, a Job Board for Mothers, Gets $80 Million to Grow
summary: The company saw a surge of job seekers joining its platform in August, which it says suggests mothers are increasingly eager to return to work. The Mom Project Inc., a recruitment firm focused on mothers, raised $80 million in new capital at what may be a pivotal moment for working women and the companies that want to hire them.

title: Theaters Count on James Bond
summary: High stakes remain for 'No Time to Die' and other fall movie releases as theater stocks have surged. The death of movie theaters has been greatly exaggerated. What exactly their new life will look like in a post-pandemic world remains to be seen.

title: EU's Balkan Expansion Plans Stall
summary: Countries in Europe's impoverished historic flashpoint see prospects of joining the EU slip away. The European Union has spent years and billions of euros preparing Balkan countries to join the bloc, an effort the U.S. has supported in the hopes that it would spread stability in a region long racked by political volatility and sporadic violence.

title: Is This the Turning Point for Aviation Stocks?
summary: Investors got burned this summer, but the trans-Atlantic reopening and improving global vaccination rates could make the current rally more sustainable. Investors who bought aviation stocks to ride the pandemic recovery have learned the hard way that this is a turbulent trip. Things could get smoother, but it is worth shelling out for a first-class ticket.

title: Cineworld Chief on Meme Stocks, Competing With AMC and the Cinema Industry's Pandemic Recovery
summary: Cineworld, the owner of Regal Cinemas, expects to recover to its pre-pandemic level of earnings and activity as soon as the fourth quarter, says CEO Mooky Greidinger. Cineworld Group Chief Executive Mooky Greidinger can be described as the mirror image of Adam Aron, his meme-loving counterpart at rival AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc.

title: Wine Deal Making Surges as Investors Look Past Covid-19 Woes
summary: Vineyard valuations rise with wave of private capital, M&A. Deal makers have targeted the wine industry, as investors bet on rising prices for winery acreage despite a Covid-19 hit to demand for the beverage.

title: Builders Hunt for Alternatives to Materials in Short Supply
summary: Swapping out materials to minimize delays in a hot housing market can add to costs. Shortages of key construction materials are forcing some builders and contractors to turn to substitutes and hunt for alternative suppliers as they rush to meet high demand for new housing.

title: Lack of Engineers Keeping Some Firms Out of the Cloud
summary: Companies are having a hard time hiring and retaining experienced talent as Covid-19 has inflated internet use. The competition for top talent in cloud computing is heating up as giants of the platform like Amazon.com Inc. and Microsoft Corp. battle with each other and the thousands of other businesses rushing to expand their use of the technology.

title: As Mississippi River Flooding Gets Worse, 100 Mayors Try a New Fix
summary: River cities partner with hunting group and others to store water in natural areas, potentially reducing by 10% the chances of a levee overtopping. SHAWNEE NATIONAL FOREST, Ill.-Mike Sertle clambered up a steep bank of the Big Muddy River in southern Illinois, whacked thick undergrowth with an oar to clear a path and after a 10-minute hike through the remote forest arrived at his destination: a low berm that could be a key to fighting floods along the Mississippi River.

title: How to Keep the Job Search Moving Forward
summary: Career coaches say these interviewing and résumé tips can help you stand out and land a new role. There are more than 10 million job openings in the U.S., so why do so many job seekers remain frustrated by hiring managers who ignore them and online application portals that delete them?

title: Oil Spill Off Huntington Beach Renews Decadeslong Move Away From Offshore Drilling
summary: A California spill 50 years ago spurred a movement to stop drilling in waters off the state. Offshore drilling in the Gulf of Mexico produces more crude oil in 2.8 days than the West Coast produces in an entire year. But a few decades ago, California's coastline was humming with activity. In 1995, the West Coast produced 92 million barrels from California's offshore reserves, according to estimates by the Energy Information Administration. By 2019, that number had plummeted to 13 million.

title: New Zealand Raises Interest Rates as Inflation, Housing Pressures Build
summary: With the economy showing signs of overheating, the central bank signaled more increases over the next year. WELLINGTON, New Zealand-New Zealand largely kept out Covid-19 by closing to the outside world, a policy accompanied by stimulus to keep the economy moving. Now the resulting labor shortages and surging demand, notably for housing, have led it to become one of the first developed economies to raise interest rates since the pandemic began.

title: Google Rolls Out Emission-Curbing Tools for Nest Thermostat
summary: Tech company says changing people's behavior around energy use will become crucial as more power comes from intermittent renewable energy sources. Google on Wednesday introduced new features for its Nest smart thermostat that will let users dial down their use of fossil fuels, the technology company's latest consumer-facing initiative aimed at addressing climate change.

title: Why Airlines Can't Stop Rewriting the Rules for Fliers
summary: Travelers usually miss these slight changes to the rules, but over time the tweaks have eroded customer rights. American Airlines changed the terms on its tickets last month to say that its "sole obligation" for flight cancellations or missed connections is to refund the remaining portion of your ticket.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Democrats Wrangle Over How to Shrink $3.5 Trillion Proposal
summary: Lawmakers consider trims to package of healthcare, education and climate-change programs. WASHINGTON-Democrats wrestled Tuesday with how to squeeze their wish list of programs and tax changes into a social policy and climate package whose size and scope centrists in the party are willing to support.

title: Zuckerberg Breaks Silence on Whistleblower Testimony
summary: 'Many of the claims don't make any sense,' CEO says, in his first public comments related to renewed debate over Facebook's role in society. Facebook Inc. Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said the company's work and motives have been mischaracterized in recent media reports and whistleblower testimony and pledged that he would continue pursuing internal research into potential harms of social media.

title: Democrats Float Changes to Filibuster Amid Debt Ceiling Standoff
summary: No clear path emerges for averting possible default later this month. WASHINGTON-Top Senate Democrats and Republicans blamed each other for the failure of Congress to raise the nation's debt ceiling, with some Democrats floating possible changes to the Senate's filibuster rule to resolve the impasse, ahead of a possible default in as little as two weeks.

title: Washington Spirit CEO Resigns in Widening Soccer Scandal
summary: Steve Baldwin, also an owner of the team, stepped down after Spirit coach Richie Burke was fired following player allegations of verbal abuse. Steve Baldwin resigned as CEO and managing partner of the National Women's Soccer League's Washington Spirit on Tuesday, as fallout continued from league-wide reports of abuse and inappropriate behavior by coaches and executives.

title: California Oil Spill Came From Pipeline Dragged Over 100 Feet
summary: Officials boost cleanup efforts, with multiple agencies working to contain the damage created by a leak connected to an offshore oil platform. State and federal officials will deploy hundreds of more people to help respond to the oil spill off the coast of Orange County, Calif., Gov. Gavin Newsom said Tuesday.

title: HHS Officials Ignored Doctor-Abuse Reports
summary: Consultants single out supervisors who could have stopped Pat Weber from preying on Native American boys. Top health officials knew of complaints about a pedophile doctor abusing Native American boys at U.S. Indian Health Service hospitals years earlier than the agency has previously acknowledged, according to an internal investigation the agency released Tuesday after a legal effort by The Wall Street Journal's publisher, Dow Jones & Co.

title: Biden Backs Powell After Sen. Elizabeth Warren Intensifies Opposition
summary: The Fed chairman, whose term expires in four months, has tried to quell a controversy over officials' investment activities. President Biden said he has confidence in Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell after Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D., Mass.) on Tuesday escalated her criticism of the central bank's leader.
